mode.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a particular way or style of behaving, living, or doing something
mode.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: the most efficient mode of transport
They have a relaxed mode of life that suits them well.
mode.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a particular way in which a machine or piece of equipment can operate
mode.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Set the monitor to 256 colour mode.
To get out of the ‘auto’ mode on the camera, turn the knob to ‘M’.
mode.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: one of various systems of arranging notes in music, such as major and minor in Western music
mode.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a way or means of doing something
mode.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: susbsidies that support environmentally-friendly modes of transport such as cycling
mode.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: the way in which a machine operates when it is doing a particular job
mode.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: When put in playback mode, the machine reproduces the actions previously performed by the operator.
mode.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: the number that appears most often in a set of numbers
